questionPool.question: At the start: An object is sitting still. It has a mass of 1 kg. There is no friction. 40N of force is applied for .1 seconds to the right. The object starts moving to the right at 4 m/s. Five seconds later: 40N of force is applied to the left. What is the object’s new velocity?

At the start. An object is sitting still. It has a mass of 1 kg. There is no friction 20N of force is applied for .1 seconds to the right. The object starts moving to the right at 2 m/s. Five seconds later: 20N of force is applied for .1 seconds down. What direction does the object go?

At the start: An object is sitting still. It has a mass of 1 kg. There is no friction. 40N of force is applied for .1 seconds to the right. Five seconds later: The object is moving to the right at 4 m/s. What would happen if the object had a mass of 2 kg instead?
questionPool.correctResponse: It would move 2 m/s toward the right.
incorrectResponses: It would move 8 m/s toward the right.
It would move 4 m/s toward the right.
It would move 1 m/s toward the right.

questionPool.correctResponse: It would move 4 m/s toward the right.
incorrectResponses: It would move 8 m/s toward the right.

It would move 1 m/s toward the right.
